text: Gold wax split 3 ways. Good but not exceptional for style. Wish it had a bit more heft.
Had this at a bottle share - about 6oz, 2016 bottle. Thick black pour. Coffee and dry. Cocoa and strong. It was a bit of a let down, but still a great beer

aroms is strange, some cherry and some smoke. flavor is really sweet, cherry, and bourbon. pours a deep reddish brown ith a reddish rtan head. thick mouthfeel. had at brians as part of a bottle share. great beer

[1/28/17] Bottle/Draught at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Black with a tan head. Huge aroma of chocolate, roast, bourbon, vanilla, fudge, cake. Sweet chewy flavor. Full-bodied, rounded, silky. Amazing.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of coffee, raw sugar, chocolate, raisins, bourbon, vanilla, wood, toffee and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee, raw sugar, chocolate, bourbon, wood and vanilla. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Velvety mouthfeel. Great stuff. Smooth, complex, delicious.

On tap at Ratebeer Best. 
Aroma is interesting with some dark fruit and red wine notes: grapes, raisins, plums and prunes with hints of berry. Moderate chocolate notes with some light roast notes. Light bourbon and a bit of oak. 
Pours black with a medium small, thick, dark mocha head that recedes steadily to the edges where it lingers before disappearing. No lacing and moderately long legs. 
Flavor is similar to the aroma with a moderate fruit character including raisin, plum, prune and lighter berry notes. Moderate chocolate with medium light roast and hints of tobacco and ash. Medium bitterness. Light bourbon notes with a bit of oak. Some light alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, not the beer I was expecting. The dark fruit was off-putting and the malt profile was a bit more muted and not as chocolate forward as I was hoping for.

Taster at Ratebeer Fest. Pours a black color without much head. Rich brown sugar maltiness. Silky mouthfeel. Mild hops. Medium sweetness.
UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Bottle thanks to Craig pours black with a dark chocolate. Viscous mouthfeel. Vanilla, cold brew coffee, pecans, raspberry. Medium sweetness.

Certaines personnes perdent leur chemise à une table de poker ou à des machines à sous. Je prédis que je perdrai la mienne en quête de cette bouteille. Marc-André, je ne saurais comment suffisamment te remercier pour cette expérience où jai goûté au Divin. Tenter de décrire cette bière serait me lancer dans une histoire sans fin où je me perdrais certainement en tentant de nommer ce qui est au-delà des mots. Mes dernières paroles seront: Assassin tu mas tué. Grâce à toi je vis maintenant.

From notes. Enjoyed this as part of the long-anticipated Toppling Goliath Brouhaha with Travis, Chris, Doug, and Ryan at Traviss house on September 24. Gold-waxed, 2014 vintage, 22 oz bottle shared by Doug. The pour on this is amazing. Dark black, thick as used oil, with a thin ring of dark brown head that fades slowly, leaving no lace. The aroma is excellent. There is a bouquet of heavy chocolate, sweet bourbon, fudge, a lovely roast, molasses, light vanilla, dark fruits Everything you want in a stout is here. Holy shit. This is just a little too forward with the bourbon. The flavor is just as incredible. The chocolate and molasses roll through a light sweet dark fruit, toasted oak, and light fudge on its way to a light vanilla finish. The bourbon presence is a little less than the nose, but its still here. The mouth feel is something else. Its heavy and thick with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly chocolate and vanilla fudgy bourbon aftertaste. This is one hell of a beer. Jesus.
A: Pitch black, no head N: Chocolate syrup, bourbon, vanilla, fudge, coffee T: Chocolate, vanilla, coffee, oak, bourbon O: Very deep and complex! Lovely indeed!

Bottle vintage 2013 shared at Maakuns with massive thanks to kermis for the trade! Black pour with no head. Massive bourbon, vanilla, deep roasted chocolate and caramel malts, toffee, creme brulee, prunes, cherries, dates. Big sweet, mild bitter. Full body, very soft carbonation. Slick and dense thick and velvety soft feel, crazy sweet finish with nice bitter undertones. Lovely!

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro, yellow wax. Black with barely any head just a small brown film. Massive sweet bourbon, vanilla, toffee, molasses, dried cherries, ash, roasted malts, strong chocolate. Just massive sweet desert notes with great bourbon on the side. Very sweet, light bitter. Full bodied with sticky feel, low carbonation and a creamy finish. Just massive.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 NEW rate: v2013 650 ml bottle. The same look and great mouthfeel as v2014 but aroma and taste are better!! More vanilla and chocolate. Delicious! ----- OLD rate:650 ml bottle v2014, from trade with Kermis, shared with Nightfall at his place. Black color with small brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, bourbon whiskey, wood, vanilla, chocolate, dark chocolate, cocoa, licorice, coffee, dark dried fruits. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full silky oily to creamy body with soft carbonation. Best mouth-feel ever! v2014 rating: 8-5-9-5-18=4.5

July 18, 2015. Bottle, 2014 vintage at Quebec tasting. Received in a trade with craftbeer1over, thanks!  Dense pitch black with a minimal brown head. Aroma is quite intense roasted malts, bourbon, toffee, dark chocolate, licorice, milk chocolate, toasted wood, hints of raisins, vanilla, dark berries and warming alcohol. Taste is sweet, rich, roasted bitterness, some warming alcohol and light spicy woody notes. Finish is sweet malty with toffee, dried fruits, vanilla, berries, bitter chocolate notes and warming bourbon alcohol. Full bodied, oily sticky texture, almost flat carbonation. 
intense and tasty but didnt beat the BA Vietnamese Speedway we had at the same tasting.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares WHLZBRZ edition, gold wax 14. Pitch black pour with a light tan head. Lots of dark dried fruits, tons of vanilla, caramel, fudge, light salty, some savoury notes. Super smooth and well deserved of the hype.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares WLZBRZ edition. This beer pours pitch oily black with a dark brown espresso head. Aroma has deep and rich bourbon notes that pulls out the most decadent notes. Dark sweet fruits, dark chocolate, chocolate cake, vanilla, roasted malts and just solid malt base all over. Also slight filled chocolates. The taste is just as you would expect. Chocolate, caramel, vanilla, dark dried fruits, bourbon, roasted malts with a thick and smooth texture. A straight up badass BA imperial stout.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ Dangerous Bottleshares - WLZBRZ edition. Pours pitch black with a dark mocha head. Aroma is delicious! Roasted malt, whiskey, dark chocolate, figs, caramel, oak, vanilla and dark dried fruits. Flavour is medium sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, thick and oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish dark chocolate, dark dried fruits and whiskey. Extremely well-balanced!

Rating number 1100! Gold wax, 2014 vintage, bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares WLZBRZ edition. Thanks to Derrin for this one! Pours a thick, pitch black with a nice, small, long lasting, tan head. Aroma is very roasty, has lots of coco nut, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, dark, dried fruits, caramel.
Taste is sweet, lots of caramel, very roasty, fudgy caramel, salty, roasty finish, oaky vanilla, bourbon. Exremely nice, dark chocolate in the finish. Extremely oily body, low carbonation. 
Close to being a perfect bourbon BA imperial stout! Better than SR-71 in my opinion.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares WHLZBRZ-edition. Pours pitch black with a small mocha head. Aroma is amazingly big and rich, huge roast, vanilla, fudge, richest dark chocolate Ive ever smelled from a stout, some dark sweet fruits, burned wood. Taste is hugeeee, roasty, strong rich dry dark chocolate, vanilla, fudge, prunes, dates, coffee, woody finish. Perfect bourbon stout for sure.

Pours a thicker night black color, with no head at all.

Smells of scorched malts, smoothed by milk chocolate, dried raisins and rock sugar. Has a rich, wooden Bourbon quality, which blends perfectly into the malts, evoking a rich chocolate profile, with molasses and matured oak on top. Scorched qualities are quite apparent, together with the slightly spicy barrel foundation.

Has a very creamy mouthfeel, due to its non existing carbonation in combination with a big amount of whipped cream. 

Tastes of molasses from the very beginning, gently wrapped up by earth and profound malts, resulting in a balanced toffee impression. Bourbon gets then introduced by pleasant, hot oak, together with even more smoothing chocolate, this time heading into a bitter chocolate direction, reminding of alcoholic truffels. The bitterness from the chocolate turns more pungent during the finish, still soft on the palate due to the beers rich cream profile. Spicy bourbon completes the rich finish, accompanied by a dry touch, leaving the palate with a long lasting warmth, working its way slowly down the stomach.

The more the beer opens up, the more I like it, especially its finish is stellar, based on its smooth cream foundation, handling Bourbon, licorice and peaty, burned malts. Its slick licorice quality grows a bit too pungent though, amped up by the malts, resulting in a sweet sticky impression, which takes up a bit too much place on the palate.
Pour is black with a tan head.. Nose is roast, cigars, cream, biurbon, marshmallow, chocolate..Taste is chocolate, spice, roast, bourbon, marshamllow.

2013 bottle shared by awesome people. Pours dark brown/black with a creamy fizzy beige head. Tastes like sweet chocolate, booze, raisin, very smooth with nice sweetness, earthy malts, dark fruits. Ligjt/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet dark fruits, earthy malt, raisin, light booze, and some chocolate and toffee.
Bottle shared by Lona and Damian. Pours an opaque black with a ring of beige head. Aroma of booze, caramel, and vanilla. Taste is amazing, roasted malts, vanilla, booze.

2013 bottle. Pours opaque black. Aroma is chocolate, roast, espresso, vanilla, booze, caramel, and faint spice. Flavor is chocolate, light booze, solid vanilla and caramel sweetness, faint roast, and some barrel character. Medium/full body.

2015 bottle. Big thanks to Couch for sharing. Aroma is awesome. Chocolate fudge, black cherry, tobacco, whiskey, light coffee, and vanilla. Tastes like chocolate syrup, smooth whiskey, dark fruit, oak, vanilla beans, sherry, and coffee. Love this stuff.
2014. Bottle to glass. Pours a thick deep down to black color. Deep roasted chocolatey malts, dark fruits, bourbon. Thick, chewy, fantastic.

Gild wax... 2014? Nose is chocolate & bourbon and tons of sweetness. Initial taste is... Hotness. Lots of barrel presence. After getting past that, Taste is sweet rich chocolate & vanilla. Tasty but the heat is distracting. Nice mouthfeel and the beer pours beautifully.

How: Bottle (22 oz) at tasting. 2014 vintage. Shared by hackobock, thanks! 

>>>A massive, rich, complex and flawless Imperial Stout that is up there with the best but doesnt have the "wow" factor that come to be expected from such an hyped beer. 

+  Rich, deep and complex flavor profile
+  Balance is rather good for such a monster beer, the body is strong enough to support everything that is going on and the light soy sauce not only isnt disturbing but also gives the beer a light salty touch that help to "lighten" in a bit 
+  The palate is especially interesting with the full body, the oily, thick and rich mouthfeel, the mouth coating sweetness and the nice alcohol warmth in the finish along salty notes and wood spiciness 
○  While this beer is really good and on par or close with the best of the style (in fact, its really close to KBBS), it is not much different than so many very good american imperial stouts. For example, I thought the Barrel-Aged Vietnamese Speedway Stout that we had at the same tasting was much better. 

Flavors:  Molasses, dark chocolate, fudge, roasted malts, alcohol, soy sauce (mild), wood spiciness

Bottle 660ml. Thx hackobock.
Pours pitch black with low/no head. Aroma is of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Taste is of chocolate, molasses, coffee, alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Low carbonation. Overall: Quite nice. Packed with flavor. Wow. Complex, fine.

Bottle shared by hackobock, thanks a lot Jacob! Pours a deep black with no head and low lacing. Nose is of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is pretty sweet and offers chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Body is full, carbonation low to medium and there is some hot alcohol in the finish. Overall a nice and rich big american imperial stout but I cant say I enjoyed it more than the average big american imperial stout. Hyped much?

bottle from hackobock, many thanks dude! pours unclear dark brown with a small beige crema cap, minimal retention. meaty and smoky roasted maltiness, sweetened bovril *TM, raisins, olives, perfume booze, umami, maple syrup and dry molasses sweetness. low carbonation, medium to full body - oily and syrupy; warming and woody-astringent-spicy finish. excellent BA stout.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Yellow wax, 2013.  Inky black. Stains the glass. Small mocha head with surface wisps.  Woo, big rye whiskey aroma. Lightly fruity. Coffee with a bit of its accompanying acidity. Dark chocolate. Whiskey is secondary to the dark chocolate in the taste. It spices it up though. Coffee then vanilla. Oak. Lots of sweetness. Rye whiskey sustained throughout.  Very thick. Medium carbonation. A little boozy but that isnt a problem.  Excellent. The beer is great despite that I dont love rye barrels.

22oz bottle 2014 gold wax vintage pours viscous dark black brown with a small finger of dark head. Nose is layered dark bourbon chocolate, peanut, wood spice, bakers chocolate, fudge, vanilla. Palate is similar with super creamy soft mouthfeel, thick, dark chocolate marshmallow vanilla, fudge, peanut, sweet, bourbon spice. Finishes with sweetness, big bourbon chocolate complexity, lived up to the hype.
22oz bottle gold wax dip. Thanks to Darrel. Worthy of its reputation. Inky black pour, stout body picks up all the right notes from the whiskey barrels. Smoky, roasty, boozy....

22oz bottle gold wax dip. Thanks to Darrel. Pours out pitch black topped with a tan head. Nose is roast malts chocolate coffee vanilla barrel bourbon and tons of sweetness. Taste is more of the sweetness thick rich chocolate coffee vanilla bourbon barrel brown sugar. Very tasty

bottle at The Ultimate Imperial Stout Tasting 2015 - all props to Kevin. Side-by-side tasting of the Morning Delight, Assassin , KBBS (all 2013) and SR-71 (freshest).
All of the beers have a good dose of silky smooth and rich sweetness, molasses and roasted barley malts in them. All of them are great beers.
- Morning Delight: more on the freshly roasted coffee, some green paprica too, sometimes a bit too rich. 4.1/5
- Assassin: my personal favourite: very balanced aroma: slight alcohol that accentuates the subtle roasted coffee notes and chocolate, together with some oak and vanilla touch. 4.5/5
- KBBS: very thick and rich, loads of molasses. Nice barrel touch. 4.3/5
- SR-71: a lot more alcohol in the aroma, as well as peanuts and roasted nuts. 4.0/5
Bottleshare thanks to homer. Pours black, not much head. Aroma is sweet whiskey , chocolate, thick. Taste is great, sweet, chocolate, sweet whiskey, yum. Really great beer.

Bottle share thanks to Homer321. 2104 gold wax bottle. Atoms of booze, whiskey, oak, chocolate. Dark, thick, black, small head, light brown head. Lots of syrupy, molasses, thick, sticky, toasty, sweet, goodness.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
thin tan ring head. Clear black pour. Lovely barrel notes. Very smooth. Awesome.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2016 Bottle shared by a friend. Big want finally! 2014 pappy version! Poured pitch black with no head. But Nice legs on the Side! Sweet roasted malts, tons of molasses, notes of dark toasted coffee, marshmallow sweetness, vanilla, smoked wood, sweet bourbon, lots of bourbon in the taste. But more in a sweet way, no real alcohol heat. Loaded with sweet bakers chocolate, rye, marshmallow keeps coming back. Very thick and silky mouthfeel. Low carbonated, but that is just right for the beer. Amazing brew! Very sweet in the finish. Incredible. Quality stuff right here. Lifts its hype! Very Nice!!
I was lucky enough to have the 2012 and 2013 at the same time and both were outstanding.

Sample, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savoured on October 2 2014; eye: black, opaque, tiny ring of dark brown head, no lacing; nose: woody, bourbon, roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, molasses; mouth: woody, bourbon, roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, molasses, woody finale with presence of hops, full body, average carbonation, mildly bitter, mildly sweet, liqueur-like texture; overall: really good
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, en fût, lors du Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savourée le 3 octobre 2014; il : noire, opaque, petit anneau de mousse brun foncé, pas de dentelle; nez : boisé, bourbon, orge torréfiée, chocolat, alcool, mélasse; bouche : boisé, bourbon, orge torréfiée, chocolat, alcool, mélasse, finale boisée avec présence de houblon, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement amère, moyennement sucrée, texture liquoreuse; en résumé : très bon

Vintage 2014. Gold wax. Bouteille partagée dans une dégustation. Merci pour linvitation! Grosse brute noire sans véritable mousse. Liquide très visqueux qui montre des jambes de chatte noire. Les arômes sont assez fabuleux : chocolat, fudge, tire dérable foncée, touche salée (老抽?), whisky, réglisse, vanille, sexe épicé, notes rôties, mélasse. Grande complexité. Dans le domaine du presque merveilleux et du fantastiquement beau. Au goût, des papilles ravies par des malts amers et doux, par une sensation liquoreuse enveloppante et par une multitude de choses mystérieuses qui te font simplement dire : wow! En bouche, un liquide épais mais jamais collant avec un pétillement très bas et une texture qui relève de la plus fine des liqueurs. Une finale profondément rôtie avec une sensuelle embrassade dun whisky piqué par le rye. Phoque, ce breuvage est tout simplement délicieux.

Vintage 2014. Noire opaque, pas de mousse. Nez de bourbon. Bouche quand même soyeuse malgré un corps assez important: beaucoup de mocha, espresso, barrique, mélasse caramélisée tirant vers lérable et une pointe presque soya salé en finale. Excellente.

2014 bottle. The beer pours an opaque black color with a medium thick foamy tan head that diminishes gradually. Rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malt, vanilla and bourbon. Full-bodied with flavors of oaky bourbon, vanilla, roasted malt and chocolate. The finish is boozy with a bourbon and chocolate malt aftertaste. Very enjoyable beer all around.

Bottles 2013 & 2014. Black pour with tan head. Roasted, whiskey, sweet malt aromas. Flavors are marshmallow, caramel, chocolate. Bourbon has vanilla touch not too much wood in either barrel. Newer batch is a touch sweeter.
Shared bomber to snifters. As viscous a pour as Ive ever poured. Minimal carbonation. Aroma is straight boozy alcohol. Taste is sugary sweet bourbon. Aroma holds this back from near perfection.

Bottle shared at Borefts beer fest day 2 27/09/2014. Bodegraven. Many thanks to whomever brought this one. Big viscous dark brown / black coloured pour. Sticky pour with a lackluster head. Aroma is big rounded creme caramel, praline, coffee bean roast, little hot alcohol. Flavour is composed of nutty choc, praline, full and smooth, bit of kamp coffee. Palate is full sticky and viscous, lowish carbonation . Good stuff

Scored on a trade in Chicago, brought to DC to enjoy with a friend. Great palate, coffee aromas without being too overwhelming, caramel to soften, full bodied, boozy. One of my favorites!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Owen for sharing

2014 gold wax

Pours black, thick and sludgy. Dark residue left on the sides of the glass. Dark chocolate head that falls to a collar. 
Nose is oak, whisky, chocolate fudge, vanilla fudge, warm roasted coffee. Thick, rich , decedent nose.
Taste is dark chocolate, vanilla, roast coffee, whisky, fudge, caramel,and soft oak. Full on and thick. Dessert beer in every way. Sweet in front but finishes dry. Long lasting finish. Chewy but not overbearing chewy. Insane beer.
Des effluves chaudes de bourbon submergés de sucres diverses, principalement chocolatés. La texture est hors norme, complètement badigeonnante. Un liquide mémorable.

Gold wax. The pour is black. The aroma is sweet bourbon. The taste is a little hot upfront, but is smooth. Some sweetness overall that I wish the bourbon would cut more. Very solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber courtesy of tkrjukoff. Thanks man! Pours oily pitch black with a thin dark mocha head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred slightly buttery wood, sweetened dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, red chill, roasted coconut, moist soil, hay and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark chocolate, brown sugar sweetened dark roast coffee, dates, dark chocolate, moist soil and intense bourbon alcohol. Mouthfeel is fat, round, round, slightly sticky sweet, boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, burnt caramel, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, burnt raisins and burning bourbon alcohol. Very hot but in a good bourbon whiskey way. Very nice decadent US imperial stout.

(Bottle) Pours black witha dark brown head. The aroma holds heavy tones of whiskey, spices, roast, hops, dark fruits and violet. The flavour is heavily sweet, heavily bitter and light to medium acidic. Aggressive but yummy roast, oak and hops. The mouthfeel round and sticky with soft/creamy carbonation. Coffee, brown sugar and hops on the finish. Full bodied.

Bottle, huge thanks to tkrjukoff. Opaque black beer with a small brownish head. Woody chocolate aroma, licorice, caramel, raisins, whisky, coffee, cocoa powder, vinous notes, figs, dades, some cream. Chocolate flavor, raisins, figs, cream, nuts, caramel, whisky notes, coffee notes, licorice, cocoa powder, molasses, brown sugar, warming alcohol. Very good.

22 oz. waxed bottle shared by b3shine from notes. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small khaki head. The aroma has roasted malts, molasses, chocolate, caramel, whiskey barrel, dark fruits favoring dates, raisins, and figs. The flavor had roasted malts, molasses, caramel, whiskey with a little bite, raisins, figs, dates, chocolate, alcohol is warming, medium to full bodied, very good, but not quite elite.

22 fl bottle, 2013 vintage. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted dark malty and. Dry roasted fruity. Roasted dark malty and breadish, dry and breadish, fruity. Dry and roasted finish.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty bourbon chocolate and caramel aroma. Roasted malty strong bourbon and chocolate flavor with hints of coffee. Has a roasted malty woody bourbon and coffee chocolate finish.

(65 cl bottle courtesy of my beer saint Ryan, thanks a lot! 2013 vintage) Poured into a burgundy glass revealing pitch black body, with little to no head but a toffee rim along the side of the glass a bit like a monks hairdo. Swirling the glass leads to a little head about half a finger in height. Putting the glass at an angle reveals some fine, pearly, lace that slides down slowly. Aroma is surprisingly subdued, the initial impression being one of bourbon with an undercurrent of vanilla and syrup. Perhaps it will reveal more as it warms. Mouthfeel is oily, bordering on the creamy. Rather full-bodied and sweet without being cloying. I dont detect much carbonation, but some must be there for the head to regenerate. Flavour is predominently sweet with aroma notes and the alcohol is lethally well-marked, like an assassin. This somehow reminds me of the Funky Buddha Maple Bacon Coffee Porter except the coffee is less pronounced here.

2013 (Yellow wax) bottle generously shared by Dallas at the holiday tasting 
Pours black motor oil with a small tan head, some lacing. The color sticks to the glass. Aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, leather and bourbon. Flavors of dark malts, sweet dark chocolate, vanilla, leather and bourbon  
Wow, the best beer of the night.

text: Poured from a 22 ounce bottle, huge thanks to Ed. Big bourbon notes, chocolate, coffee, malty. Raisin, caramel, rich beer.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2015 Bottle @ home, tfs Benzai! Aroma is huge roast, burned liquorice, dark chocolate, coffee and more. Flavour is huge bitter roasty liquorice molasses coffee madness. LRAB.

Bottle shared @ tasting. Opaque pitch black color, small dark brown head. Aroma is malts, lightly whisky, lightly vanilla, lightly dark chocolate. Pretty subtle aroma for such a big stout. Taste malts, dark malts, roasted malts, medium to heavy roast and roasty bitter, subtle liquir influences, bitterness. Full body, medium carbonation, thick oily texture. Oh its fucking delicious.

Bottle, red wax. Pitch black pour, with a dark brown head. Dark chocolate, vanilla bean, licorice, chocolate fudge, brownies, oak barrel character, mild booze, and notes of dark fruit. Very very rich, but still silky smooth. Awesome dessert beer. This blew my socks off.
Bottle hand at Borefts. Black beer. Hot aroma. Hot chocolate thick. Tarry choc some heat. Ok.

This poured a dark brown, no head a Tad flat. Aroma was of big barrel, chocolate and marshmellow and booze. Flavor was similar, sweet Bourbon, marshmellow, vanilla, chocolate, undercarbed and a little boozy.
Bottle thanks to charule. Pours a inky oily black with no head at all. Aroma is nutty, vanilla, cocoa powder, alcohol. Sweet and hot. Flat as anything. Good stuff but could be better.
Bottle thanks to trade. Poured thick black with no head. Aroma of charred marshmallow dark fruit bourbon. No carb thick bod. Sweet roasty choc brown sugar taste. Good stuff

Sample from 65 cl. bottle with yellow wax - 2013 Vintage. Pitch black with a creamy, tanned head. Roasted aroma with rich, dark malts, liquorice, vanilla and barrel, lots of coffee. Some chocolate and subtle alcohol. Taste is bitter and roasted. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and roasted with lots of coffee, herbal hops and rich, dark malts. Really delicious, excellent Stout.

Bottled. Vintage 2013. Pitch black coloured. Dense brown head. Aroma. Roast, sweetness, cocoa, light coffee, vague smoke, vanilla, chocolate, light molasses and vague alcohol. Flaovur.. Roast, vanilla, coffee, liqourice, chocolate, molasses, alcohol. Full bodied. Ends full of spice and roasted bitter. Very well balanced and sweet.
Sample from Bottle - black pour with tan head. Aroma and taste is roasted malty, with lots of vanilla, light chocolate, caramel, coffee, lovely mouthfeel with some,

Bottle 65 cl. Vintage 2013. Pours an almost syrupy thick, pitch black with a small, brown head. Sweet rich, vanillaish roast in the nose with lovely Bourbon accents. Extremely rich body, syrupy almost, sweet vanilla roast and again heavy, yet mellow Bourbon notes. Warming alcohol finish. A lovely HUGE Imperial Stout. 081114

Bottle from chase! Pours thick black with low head dark head. Aroma is rich roast, and bourbon. Taste is super thick roast and chocolate, well balanced bourbon, awesome long lasting finish, spectacular. No gimmicks here

2014 vintage. Pours jet black, like spent motor oil. Slowly, a brown head bubbles up and dissipates quickly into a ring around the glass. Very viscous beer! Legs for days and days. Aromas is very boozy. Lots of wet oak and bourbon upfront...with hints of chocolate, molasses and coffee creeping in. Taste is another story. Damn. Lots of milk chocolate upfront, creamy vanilla notes....coffee and some more coffee...what a harmony! These TG stouts have some signature sweetness that threads them all together. Maybe hints of maple syrup that permeate throughout? A medium-heavy mouthfeel that never becomes too much with the light carbonation...and just the right amount of sugars in this to cut the booze down. Finishes with a gentle warming bourbon touch....not as heavy as the nose suggested, but prominent. A fantastic imperial stout that puts TG in a class by itself.

2014 bottle, gigantic thanks to my man Sam for bringing this all the way from Chicago!!!! Perhaps the most dense, viscous pour Ive ever seen in my life; almost chocolate syrup in quality, with a small bubbly head around the edge of the glass. The nose and flavor were quite simply intoxicating; soft dark chocolate bitterness and heavily roasted coffee gave way provided the background. Up front was enormous sweet chocolate ganache, mocha and sweet milk chocolate, vanilla, marzipan, nougat, and hints of marshmallow. While rich, the palate wasnt overbearing, and this drank marvelously. An outstanding product, reminiscent of Bourbon County Coffee but better. Glorious stuff.

Lucky enough to buy a bottle at the release(2014), poured into a snifter. Motor oil black and beer is about as thick. Tiny head with complex aromas rising. Bourbon is predominant with some vanilla, chocolate and coffee notes. Taste is more complex than anything I have ever experienced. Sweetness at the beginning with some coffee and chocolate in the middle, followed by the bourbon booze. I also get this umami thing going no with some notes of soy sauce. My palate was not as refined when I tried it, so I didnt enjoy it that much. That being said, I can definitely appreciate the beer for what it is.

Opaque black, moderate beige head. Caramel, vanilla, chocolate, a little coffee, and hints of bourbon barrel. Bittersweet with a long bitter finish. Creamy and smooth, a bit slick, full bodied, and viscous. Mild to moderate booziness.

Bottle shared by kermis @ Borefts 2014. Pours this thick, picht black liquid with a small, brownish head on top. Aroma is perfect, full, complex smells of licorice, laurel, vanilla, caramel, oak, molasses. Basically every aroma you want in an imperial stout is present, all balanced to perfection. I simply couldnt stop sniffing this stuff. Flavor is very sweet with again all the characteristics of an imperial stout, but then exactly the way its supposed to be. Thick mouthfeel, alcohol is present in the flavor but gives no burning sensation. Flavor is complex with woody influences, dark overripe fruits, vanilla, molasses. The barrel treatment is noticeable. Incredibly good stuff, certainly deserves its high rating. This is liquid sex in a glass...

Sampled at GABF 2014. Black pour with a thin brown head. Incredible aroma of German chocolate cake, vanilla, oak, and bourbon. Taste of chocolate, coffee, booze, and vanilla. Warm finish. Somehow my Iowa rating is the last of the U.S. states but it was well worth the wait. A perfect 5!!

On draft at GABF 2014. Pours a deep stout brown with a tan head. Nose is big boozy bourbon, chocolate syrup, vanilla, roast, and some sweetness. Flavor is similar with big bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, sweetness, oak, and booze. Huge flavor and boozy oakiness. Medium and syrupy in body with lingering boozy chocolatey bourbon.

Multiple pours from tap at GABF 2014. Appearance is pitch black with a frothy brown head ans sticky lacing. Big chocolate, coconut, light roast, some oak, coffee, caramel, toffee and brownie batter in the aroma. Taste rich and creamy milk chocolate bar, bourbon notes, some raisins, brown sugar, vanilla, a hint of espresso, and chocolate cake with a semi-sweet, yet roasted finish. Full mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Decadent, rich, and full-bodied. Mmmmmmmm rareness.

Tap at GABF. Dark hue with brown head. Aroma is huge whiskey, oak, toffee, caramel. Full body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet followed by a nice astringent following that really balances everything out. Overall this is amazing!
sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: dunkelbraun, fast schwarz, kein Schaum. Geruch nach sehr viel Kaffee, schokoladig, reife Früchte, so ist auch der Geschmack, ein sehr gutes Bier!
Bottle at de molen...deep black thin tan lacing ... Dark chocolate. Massive meaty nose ... Dark chocolate roast malts nose... Dark fruits.. Light bourbon... Slight spice...heavy sweet roast

Most recent release. Nice looking black pour with s dark creamy head. Nose is pretty rich but I can tell pretty easily itll be sickeningly sweet like last years. And taste is just that. Super sweet and boozier than I remember last years, but fortunately not as pruney. Thick syrupy mouthfeel. Really difficult task choking down a few ounces.

2014 gold wax bottle from trade. Humungo thanks for this one. Pours thick viscous pitch black looking thicker than any beer I have poured, including dark lord and Hunahpu. Not really anything but a ring of dark brown head. Beautiful aroma of vanilla, toasted coconut, caramel, chocolate, oak, bourbon, dark fruit, hint of roast but mostly sweet. Flavor is bourbon up front with toasted coconut and vanilla galore, a hint of chocolate, oak, more bourbon. Finishes with a blast of vanilla bourbon and wood that is just amazing. Thick bodied with low carbonation but not as sickly syrup thick as expected from the look of this thing. TG is just stupid good when it comes to making beer. Jeez.

2013 Bottle at a tasting. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of bourbon, malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is bourbon, roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, coffee, wood, and vanilla. Amazing stuff.

2014 Bottle. Pour is viscous black with a medium tan head that fades quickly into a ring. Aroma of bittersweet chocolate, slight bourbon, roasted coffee, light espresso, and dairy creamer. Flavor is similar with the bourbon coming through a bit more - oak chips, dark fruit, brown sugar, dark chocolate, warming alcohol. Great.

2014 vintage yellow wax bottle pours like dirty motor oil with a thin tan head and coats the glass like oil as well. Wonderful oak, whiskey, raisin aromas with hints of chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. Delicious! Bytemesis, you will not be disappointed.....if I can hold on to that last bottle long enough!

Pitch black motor oil body. Almost no head, but who cares. Woo that smells good. Chestnut aroma with an awesome whiskey smell. Good amount of alcohol aroma. Really sweet. Almost a prune raisin taste. Lots of woody barrel tastes. Similar to a fine brandy. Too much going on to explain. Just an absolutely excellent beer.

I cant not give it a perfect score. Im in love. Amazingly heavy, thick pour. The aroma takes over. The first smell is sweet with a hint of nuts. The first sip is sweet & is a reminder of a brandy. This small glass is not enough... I definitely want more!

Yellow wax. Served alongside Mornin Delight and KBBS.

The beer is near black with an oily beige head. Whiskey aroma with vanilla, oak, chocolate. Again, absolutely amazing. Big whiskey character with a lovely coffee presence. Full bodied with oak and vanilla. Palate coating. My second favorite of the trio. Fabulous!
Heavy bourbon and medium dark chocolate and raisin smell. Taste is the same with a bit of booze.

2014 Bottle thanks to Minh. Pours a motor oil with tan head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong roast, dark chocolate, wood, booze. Thick mouthfeel with nice syrupy roast, coconut, dark chocolate, light booze, oak. Very impressive.

Comparing this to Chocolate Rain or Borbon County.....it just didn?t have all it?s flavors on the palate creating a symphony of flavors....there?s an alcohol burn with the taste of soy sauce....and it?s thick like whole milk.

22 oz bottle is yellow wax (2013) shared by Huhzubendah, thanks Matt! Pours a near black with a lasting edge head that leaves minimal lacing. Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruit syrup, slight oak and vanilla. Flavor is same with full carbonation balancing the full syrupy mouthfeel. Delicious with dark cherries and rye in the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 8/8/14 Bottle from Clark of TG at the new glarus release party. This has a lot of great bourbon nose. Taste is oak and vanilla. Had a touch of apple sweetness. Smooth with no heat. Very good stuff.  Served warm, probably didnt help. 4.1


10/18/14, yellow and gold wax side by side. Amazing mix of bourbon and fudge. No apple off flavors this time.  Thick and chewy. 13 was slightly better. This is really good stuff. 4.3

22oz bottle (batch 1) in a tulip. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, bourbon and oak and vanilla, some chocolate, light sweetness, and hints of dark fruits. Flavor the same with a great blend. Smooth, thicker texture. A really, really good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2014 2014 vintage. First review? Black. Very black. Tan head. Quite the beast. Aroma is big. Bourbon. Lots. Vanilla. Graham crackers, oreos dunked in condensed milk. Toasted coconut. 63% chocolate. Espresso, toffee, molasses. Yep, all of that. This is big, its sweet, and it is quite delicious. The barrel character is quite tame. Booze is in check. It is thick. It is chewy. Not much bitterness offered. Smooth, creamy, minimal carbonation. This hits all notes a BA imperial stout has to offer. Honestly one of the best Ive ever had.
Bottle - Bittersweet chocolate and bourbon barrel. Jet black with a brown head. Big rich chocolate, long syrupy finish. Booze is there but subtle, as are bottle notes. Very nice.

Bottle. Yellow wax, Generously shared by Adam (the alumn). Thick black oily pour, nice bit of tan mocha head. Aroma, roast, oak, bourbon, and chocolate, Taste, thick mouthfeel, syrup, oak, vanilla, ash, smooth finish. Yea. This is really fucking good.

The waxed bottle pours with a thick dark mahogany colored body that supports a tan head. The aroma booms with chocolate, booze, sweet coconut, smooth bourbon that has a candy like quality to it and then some dark roasted to thinly burnt malts. Dig it. The taste is just rich smooth deep goodness, oh my. I get residual sugars, some chocolate, sweetened dark roasted coffee, smooth bourbon and then a soft thin coconut sensation. Wow. It is nectar sweet and rich and ending with a pleasing bourbon and marshmallow to chocolate sensation. Wonderful sipper.

Sampled @ Woodshed 3.0!  The ever generous Dak sponsored the pour...gracias!  Dark onyx pour with a tightly packed latte cream perched on top. Very decadent and complex, with brownie batter and cocoa dusted Kona coffee beans accompanied by oak, spicy rye, and a hint of hops. The alcohol is completely invisible and the mouthfeel is chewy. Worthy of its standing.

Pours a deep oily black with a trace of sticky khaki foam. Rich chocolate syrup, heavy roasty tar, licorice, vanilla creme and a touch of smoked coconut bordering on tamari. High levels of sweetness but the complexity surrounding it make it a yummy treat.
At jacobs with group. Pour is black with brown head. Aroma thick musky dark roasted malts, complex. Taste is beautiful complex smooth roasts malt. Fantastic.
Pours pitch black with a nice tanned head. Aroma is tons of roastiness chooclate some vanilla bourbon some sweetness cofee. Flavor similarily massive rich, longlived tasty finish.
Had this at a great neighborhood tasting. Thanks to everyone for sharing! Had so much fun!
one of the those few overhyped beers that is definitely worthy of the praise.

Bottle shared by Ignace at the Hopduvel. Aroma is wonderful, lots of vanilla, oak, whiskey. Taste is perfect, rich caramel, chocolate, vanilla, really desserty without ever being cloying. Palate is silky smooth, super easy drinking. Insanely good.

Bottle shared at Hopduvel, Gent, big thanks to Bobochamp. Pours black with no real head. Aroma of rich milk chocolate, caramel, fudge, light roast, light whiskey but subdued and great. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Chewy and oily in the mouthfeel. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Superb!

More like Toppling over... ? .. . Excited to try this .. . Dark siamese cat face on the pour .. Mild foam .. . Charcoal, chewy tar and rather light though unique barrel .. . Medium mouth, quite a mild finish .. Was expecting more .. . . Oh, and remember: next Friday... is Hawaiian shirt day. So, you know, if you want to, go ahead and wear a Hawaiian shirt and jeans.

25/II/14 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: n/a (2014-211) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, small dark brown head, little stable. Aroma: alcohol, whisky notes, vanilla, chocolate, mocha, cocoa powder. MF: no carbon, full body, creamy smooth texture. Taste: sweet and sugary start, lots of caramel, fudge, very ripe banana, dark chocolate, sugary, little bitter. Aftertaste: lots of vanilla, caramel, alcohol warming the throat, more chocolate, fudge, sugary touch. Wow, an amazing brew, this one!

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2015 65cl, Vintage 2014 (gold wax), new exclusive American brew, with coffee, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex sweet Stout, roasted/sweet and slightly woody/spicy, yet not too heavy, very balanced, cloudy, small head, top class!, yet very expensive!, "Awesome beer to celebrate my 4900 rating! I sincerely hope I will succeed in tasting the most awesome beer before I reach 5000 ratings. Thanks folks for helping me out!"

2013 vintage 
Pours black . Really, really black . good brown foam lasts quite long for these kind of beers .. 
smell is mostly coffee, along with some whiskey . 
good carbation
taste is extremely good again .. seriously, TG, thats the third beer I had from you guys, and all are damn near perfection ! 
I get coffee, sweetness , whiskey , oak , vanilla ,...
The body is nice and thick, yet not extremely thick there . Some nice alcohol warmth , very nice aftertaste ( sweet coffee, oak , some whiskey notes ) 

Damn, should I now call this my new favourite brewery ? 
When you get the chance, do get this beer ! ( and trade it to me )

A- pours an inky opaque black with a light tan had that quickly returns to a thin skin. Very mild lacing. S- maple syrup, vanilla, milk chocolate, are heavy. Cacao, dried cherries, green apples, whiskey peat, dates, pecans, heavy grains, toffee, marshmallows, graham crackers, earth are all present. And wonderfully so. M- medium oily and smooth body, with a sweet, full palate. Medium carbonation. T- maple syrup, vanilla, and malty caramel grains up front. Pancakes throughout. Marshmallows, graham crackers, figs, fudge brownie, toasted coconut, zinc, in the middle. Alcohol burn starts towards the end. Ending shows some light hop notes mixed with bitter bakers chocolate, more fudge, tart fruits and dark fruits.

Bottle @ The HUGE Tasting. Cheers to Bruce! (I think). The pours deep brown with a small head. The nose is massive, rich. Loads of fudge-covered espresso beans. Vanilla swirl ice cream. Hot boozy barrel. The taste similarly robust. Notes of runny caramel, vanilla. More coffee and dark chocolate. Hot woody finish. Full body, oily, and smooth. Overall, really impressive.

Pour is black with mocha head. Nose is bourbon, light wood, some malt body, Lots of sugar and sweetness. Taste is more sweet, lots of sugar, caramel, sweet. Lighter malt complexity, barrel isnt poorly integrated. Body is thick and creamy, moderate carbonation.

(22oz bottle) inky black, deep brown head. Nose of coffee, milk chocolate, light green apple, but the taste is insane. Taste of milk chocolate, rich dark chocolate, no element stands out more than another, not Overly roasty which I totally appreciate. Toasty marshmallow. Medium to thick body. So awesome.
Bottle. Pours a black color with white head. Thanks to bacterial for sharing. Chocolate brownie, sweet, roasty flavors and a touch of alcohol burn. Tasty.

Bottle @ Armins house, courtesy of Bacterial. Thanks! 2013 vintage. Pours a black appearance with a dark brown head. Quite roasty, dark chocolate, a bit smoky woody, whiskey aroma. Really thick and gooey, rich chocolate cake batter, vanilla, coffee, spicy whiskey flavor. Thick and tasty.

2013 Yellow Wax affair, acquired in a trade and shared at the HUUUUUGE Friday tasting at Bruces pad, 03/01/14.
Pitch black with a well appointed dirty tan head.
Nose is sweet, bitter chocolate, dark fruit tang, subtle bourbon, chocolate cake mix.
Taste comprises rich decadent chocolate goo, bourbon twang but well integrated, rich dark malt, black forest gateau.
Full bodied, smooth as, soft carbonation, expertly pitched mouthfeel.
Top draw impy, a little too sweet at times but decent none the less.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 3rd January 2014Mega Tasting at Bruces pad. Big cheers to Senior Bois for this treat. Opaque dark brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is softish and semi dry. Rich dark malt cream and dark chocolate. Lighter coffee cream and a touch of spice. Underneath are bourbon accentuated dark fruits. Rich and sumptuous.

2013 bottle, generously shared by C-Dogg at the BIG Friday tasting. It pours opaque black with a small dark tan head. The nose is rich roast, coffee, mild acidity, toasted coconut, juicy dark fruit, berry and even more coffee. The taste is rich-roast, juicy berry, fudge, creamy, treacle, molasses, chocolate, wood and a good deal of vanilla with a bitter-sweet finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Big, rich and oily. Smooth, slick and well-integrated. Nice.

Bottle at the big ass tasting. Getting a little pissed by this stage. Big thanks to Colin for this yellow waxed bad boy. Black pour with a dark tan head. A nice change from all the cloudy ass Lost Abbey beers we just went through. Nose is huge vanilla bean and milk chocolate. Some light smoke behind it all with a nice kick of aniseed and coconut. Even a hint of pepper there. Very sweet and decadent stuff. Taste is in your face vanilla and milk chocolate - absolutely vanilla beans, peppers, lactose, very milky and creamy, like a chocolate creme caramel. Roasty marshmallow comes to mind. Seductively sweet with a rich smokiness behind it all. Very good stuff

Bottle shared in London during the First Tasting of the New Year. Big thanks to C-Train. Pours oily black-brown with a thick, creamy brown head. Looks good. The nose has rich chocolate, mild roast, raisins. Medium to big sweet flavor, lots of oily chocolate, buckets of molasses, iodine, chocolate cake. Full bodied with fine carbonation and creamy texture. Lightly warming to finish with sticky sugars, more molasses, syrupy chocolate, burnt marshmallows, black urbanites, raisins. Decadent. Deep. Great beer.
Yellow Wax, gift from SJ. Im going to have to keep my eye on this brewery. So far two beers, so far great product. GGood blend of chocolate roast, whiskey and wood. Really good as it warms.

Bottle: 2013, yellow wax... thanks, Ron! Dark, dark brown, nearly black pour with a tiny tan head that fades almost instantly into a thin collar. Aroma loaded with notes of dark cocoa, fudge, lots of brown sugar, light vanilla, smooth whiskey character, & some back-end oak-y & wood-like tons. Taste has a nice punch of whiskey-soaked oak up front, fading into sweeter notes of chocolate, burnt brown sugar, cocoa, solid vanilla, & a touch of barrel-induced coconut. Good balance of boozy & sweet all around. Brown sugar & whiskey warmth in the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 2013 yellow wax bottle shared by thebitterendaz. Pitch black, thick pour with tiny head. Coffee and bourbon aroma is mesmerizing. Dark chocolate, sugar, bourbon, and slight caramel finish for lasting mouthfeel. Sweet, but not overly so. Many delicious layers of flavor with every sip as it warms. Would definitely pair well with plain ol' vanilla ice cream.

651mL yellow wax 2013 bottle at the SDBW kickoff bottle share. Pours a deeper black, cola highlights. Aggressive, reddish foam. Nose is big sticky alcohol, not much going on at all. Taste is rich melted dark chocolate, some red fruitiness, lots of sugar piling on, flashes of soy and seaweed. Just too sweet for me.

TG continues to impress. Pours a pitch black viscous pour with nice brown head that lasts. Aroma is bourbon, coffee, light chocolate, and some spicy malt. Taste is heavily sweet and the only thing keeping this from perfection. The barrel characteristics are perfection with just the right amount of bourbon and barrel notes. Love it.
Bomber, wow so rich and thick, this is very impressive, tons of barrel aging, great bourbon flavors, great stuff

Pours basically black with a small head that pretty well dissipates. 

The aroma is sweet, plenty of plum and raisin offered... the booze character is more reminiscent of rum than bourbon, but its got that nice vanilla sweetness. It smells roasty with a touch of ashiness and some toffee. 

The flavor pretty rich and sweet; cool fruits like raisins, cherries, & figs are offered, as is a big bourbony character. S a touch boozy, caramel forward, roasty and has a good bit of vanilla expression. 

Plenty mouth coating.

Pretty good... sheesh. 


This is not a shelf beer.

Aroma: Bourbon, Chocolate, Mildly Boozy

Appearance: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Brown Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Milk Chocolate, Roasted Malts

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Sweet

Bottle, shared by dtmets84, 10/04/2013. Pours tar black, thick, hazy medium-tan head, thin ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is dark chocolate brownie, touch of coffee, bready caramel, whiskey. Taste is thick syrupy chocolate, caramel infused, light vanilla, mellow bourbon notes. Thick, creamy smooth body. Quite nice indeed.

Shared with the Saturday afternoon football and beer gang. Im going to try to stay reserved with this review but holy crap this blew me away. The balance here between the beer and whiskey barrel age treatment is one of the best Ive ever had. The barrell adds a subtle and measured amount of complexity and flavor to an already solidly smooth and delicious beer. Big chocolate malt flavors and sweetness. The aging gives you a nice vanilla and oak aroma. Not getting much of the coffee. Bit of alcohol on the back end of the sip and as it warms but again, comes in perfectly to remind you you are drinking a big barrel aged beer.

Bottle shated with DeadCatATL, Jrob21 and EricTeusink. The biggest highlight of a stellar day. Super intense/blod flavors of big bourbon, sweet chocolate, lots of chocolate (sweet, dark, milk), coffee, espresso. This one was just awesome, awesome stuff. We have another bottle to trade, but it is now being contemplated to experience all over again. Super thick and milkshake like.

RBSG 2013. Black and silky smooth palate. The coffee and whiskey are pronounced in the aroma, while the flavor is surprisingly sweet and full of sugar. A small nip bottle would be plenty of this beer.

22oz bottle, shared by b3shine. Very dark brown, near-black color. Thin lighter brown head. Ropes and dots of lace. Big spicy vanilla whiskey barrel nose. Chocolate, brownie. Good coffee. Moderate sweet taste, not cloying. Light bitterness, some alcohol warmth, little dark fruit in the flavor, hint of molasses and smoke. Smooth, chewy, kind of velvety texture. Light carbonation. Bigger body. Lightly sticky. Lightly biting and sweet in the finish. Tasty, complex beer.

dark with thin, lasting cocoa head . Nose is burnt and stinging, sugary brownie and excessive plum. Ultra sugar flavor, lightest cake elements, burnt and sticky with lasting sugars dominating everything. Drinking 4oz was too much.

Thanks to beerbob26 for the share. 22 oz. yellow waxed bottle served in a Firestone Walker mini-snifter. 2013 vintage.

A: Pours a dark black color with a dark brown head forming on the pour. It recedes to a thin ring that leaves some splotchy lace down the glass.

S: Bourbon up front with some dark fruit and sweet vanilla. Chocolate with some caramel notes and some light oak. Roasted malts give it a touch of dryness.

T: The bourbon barrel is up front. Bourbon with some oak, vanilla sweetness and a little burnt sugar. Bakers chocolate with some oak and a honey like sweetness on the finish.

M: Medium to heavy bodied with a slick and oily mouthfeel. Medium to low carbonation with a bourbon sweet finish.

O: A really nice BA stout. Not in the upper echelon, but Id gladly have this again. Pretty tasty and balanced overall.

Serving type: bottle

09-06-2013

Bomber to snifter (shared by me with the group; thanks JAXSON). Batch 2. Looks good; a fairly viscous semi-opaque dark cola with thin tan lacing. Smells of dark malt, coffee, and strong rye whiskey barrels. Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel. Good beer.

22oz bottle, 2013 yellow wax edition, via trade. pours an imposing, dense, oil-slick black capped by a rich, creamy head of rusty mocha that leaves rich sheets of oily lace. aroma is absolutely fantastic with huge notes of chocolate brownies, roasted malts, graham crackers, toffee, and sweet vanilla backed by toasted barrel, subtle rye, nutella, and marshmallow cream. flavor is magnificent with a sublime balance of sweet toffee, caramel, brownies, and vanilla with charred barrel, subtly spiced rye whiskey, mocha coffee, and hints of dry ash. palate is smooth, rich, and full bodied but remarkably drinkable with a long finish of roast, whiskey, and cocoa. overall, I wasnt sure this would live up to the hype, but it does that and then some. a world class effort. wow.

Bottle. Huge thanks to 5000, both for setting up the tasting and for sharing this after my own attempts to procure it failed. Appearance: Pours thick, viscous, dense, motor oil with tan head. Aroma: Alcohol is big on the nose, smells like whiskey; some leathery smokiness (bacon -- I smell bacon). Vanilla, brown sugar / molasses. Maple syrup. The more I stick my face in this the better and more complex it smells. Smells like its going to be a huge, boozy beer. Taste: super fucking sweet. Stout, rye. Coffee comes through only in the finish. Palate: Rich, thick, viscous texture. Silky, oily, full body. Overall: Sweet, rich and intense. Overall: diabetes in a glass is indeed an apt description. That sweetness started out a bit much for me, but grew on me over the course of the drink. It would be hard to drink a lot of this in one sitting -- all the more reason to share it with friends over (or instead of) dessert.

Bottle: &nbsp 2013 version, thanks to Skyview! &nbsp Deep black pour, viscous, thin to moderate brown head, so-so lacing. &nbsp Soft boozey nose, roasty, sweetened coffee, rye, and faint dark chocolate. &nbsp Smooth on the tongue, not as thick as say Mornin Delight, but smooth and flavorful. &nbsp Sweet chocolate, roast, coffee, not acrid at all. &nbsp Smooth from start to finish. &nbsp Not as much depth and spiciness as Mornin Delight, a little simpler, but still very tasty. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Whiskey, coffee, sweet chocolate on the finish. &nbsp Great stuff!

Sampled from a 0.65l bottle @ Top Hops (BA) bottle share. Jet black in the glass with a nice small dark but fat mocha brown top. It has this oily and thick mouthfeel with a soft prickling carbonation level. Fantastic chocolate - deep as a cellar nose. Just all black and thick. Some syrupy thing, fantastic nose with lots of espresso. Its sweet but not cloying. Lots of warming alcohol. Its a flavor bomb this. Amazingly rich and complex. Lots of wood, deep dark chocolate, some espresso and it even has something that reminds me of home made black ice cream. What a mess of a rating but this is one amazing beer! 15.06.2013
Bottle sampled at rbsg. From notes. Boozy with bourbon, chocolate, banana snd burnt wood. I wish i had one of my own to bring back.
Oily black with no head. Toasted marshmallow aroma. Very sweet aroma. Flavor is dominated by bourbon. Sweet and tasty but not out of this world.

Bottle shared by CLevar at RBSG. Pour is black with minimal head. Aroma is coffee, whiskey and roasted malts, flavor matches aroma with the whiskey coming in strong. Mouth coating, sweet and very good.
Pours oily black brown with a thin khaki head. Aroma is sweet sugary roasted malt some vanilla. Taste is sweet oily vanilla with some roasted malt. Palate is full slick.

Bottle shared by CLevar! Rich dark black pour, thick ring of carbonation and a really nice meld of coffee and whiskey. Flavor is incredibly well balanced chocolate, whiskey, hints of coffee. Wow, really nice.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bottle. Super thick dark black pour. Soooo sweet. Diabetes in a glass. Rich and awesome. I love this beer.

Absolutely re-goddam-diiculous. The aroma is chocolate, sweet and spicy rye whiskey, licorice, bread. The appearance is jet black, deep tan head. The flavor is chocolate, whiskey, bread, licorice, fruit nice. Awesome thick body, creamy mouthfeel. The finish was a modest booze burn, sweet chocolate, light roast. Completely awesome. A great example of barrel aging that augments the beer, without overpowering it. The rye whiskey gave it a tangy spicy quality as well. And its. great imply stout in its own right.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2013 Yellow waxed bottled. Poured dark brown with a whisp of espresso colored head

Flavor was warm, whiskey, rye, extreme , mouth coating

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2013 Bottle shared by GOTC at the Amarin Cafe. Rating 5,500. Pours black with tan head. Nose and taste of vanilla, chocolate cake, whiskey barrel, oak, sweet molasses, sweet chocolate and roasted nuts. Medium body. Smooth.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 Whoa boy. Poured from a bottle into tulip glass. I know we all say things pour like motor oil, but this was the blackest, oiliest thing I've ever poured. Almost no head and tons of lacing. Aromas of strong soy sauce, chocolate, and some booze. Really, this thing looked and smelled like it had been aging for two or three years. Flavor was terrific. Loads of rich chocolate with a background of cherries and bourbon barrel. well balanced and not nearly as sweet as last years, thought it will wear on you after a while. This is a mature, refined beer that stands up with the best of them. An absolute home run from TG.

Bottle shared by Bill, thanks bro, been wanting to try this one since I heard it was better than recent dark lord vintages which isnt saying much, but still needed to sample it. Pours pitch, oily black with thin head and barely any lacing. Mouthfeel is very sticky and thick, Nose of bourbon, banana cream pie, dark chocolate, char, and wood. Flavor follows suit with lots of rye, coffee and bitter cocoa powder left over. Full body, warming. My only complaint is its a little too viscous, but it works for the beer and the style. Awesome.

22 oz bottle, yellow wax 2013 version. Pours thick black with a creamy mocha head. Nose is sticky and sweet with a lot of dark fruits and various dessert like elements. Some chocolate brownie, Im comparing it to BCBS and its not all that dissimilar. Mouth is quite sweet, thick. In addition to the dark chocolate, gooey elements there are cherries, red berries, other fruits. Hot bourbon barrel char on the finish. This will impress a lot of people and it is pretty good, but I would have liked a drier feel with more barrel complexity and less overt sugar bomb.

Sample from bottle at Perennial STL beer week event. Pour is black with a think tan head. Aroma and flavor are loaded with smooth roasted malt, light coconut, light toffee malt, and light vanilla. Very rich and full flavor, awesome.

Sampled at Perennials Belgian Fest. Almost black and thick looking. It looks great. A nose of bourbon, vanilla, and so rich malts. The flavor is bourbon, char, vanilla, roasted malts. A thick smooth feel. This is very good.

22 oz. bottle, sent from mista (thanks a lot, Geoff), pours black with a small brown head. Aroma brings out dates, roasted malt, licorice, and treacle toffee. Flavour brings out loads of complex dark fruits - dates, figs -, treacle toffee, caramel syrupy, and molasses. Extremely viscous mouthfeel, with the dark fruits and syrupy dominating the flavour profile. Wow - this is complex. I dont really get much coffee and whiskey barrels at all. Exceedingly rich and deep. Not the easiest to drink due to the viscous, syrupy nature of this. Still, wonderful stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2014 (2014 Release - Gold Wax - PVW Barrel)Bottle... This beer still rocks!... Pours Marshal Zhukov-black with a tiny, brief head. The aroma is a swirl of fudge, bourbon, vanilla, lightly toasted coconut, chocolate crème and cinnamon. Huge-bodied and velvety with pillow-soft carbonation. The flavor is rich, boozy, bittersweet and burnt. A bit too sweet, but otherwise absolutely delicious. Love this years treatment even more than last years. Bottle courtesy of the always-generous ctipping!Original Rating (2013 Release - Yellow Wax - Rye Barrel) = 4.2
Bottle This beer rocks! Pitch black pour with a small, short-lived, creamy, beige head. The nose is a decadent mélange of fudge, toasted nuts, a splash of vinous tawny port and a light rye whiskey component. Full-bodied and chewy with laid-back carbonation. The flavor is bittersweet and deeply roasted with splashes of sweet port and warm rye. Nice, deeply-roasted finish with a lingering rye whiskey aftertaste.  World class beer from a world class brewer (badbeer)!

Bottle. Big thanks to Hopscotch for sharing this gem. Dark brown pour with a light brown head. Incredible caramel and chocolate aromas. Great lacing. Sweet with some cola like qualities. Caramel, chocolate, and woody notes with a fair amount of heat from the rye in the finish. Very good mouthfeel and body.

Bottle thanks to Hopscotch. 2013 yellow wax. Dark pour with small tan head. Smell is an amazing mixture of coffee, chocolate, and whiskey. Really enjoyed the rye whiskey component in this beer. Well done. Thanks Eric!

Bottle thanks Hopscotch - Pours black with dark tan head and lots of viscosity. Smells of wood, rye, and vanilla. Taste of chocolate, woody, and vanilla. It's a little harsh on the back end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
BAD ASS. Dark as hell pour, brown head. Flavors? Coffee and whiskey and just a kick ass beer. Sweet and thick. Delicous. Wow. Thanks to TheAlum yet again.
Yellow wax. Rich black with a thick brown head. Great chocolate and bourbon nose and flavor. Thick and dense. Completely tongue coating. Just as good, if not better then BA DL.
Pours a dark Black with light brown head, aroma of whiskey, sweet chocolate, vanilla, and whiskey, a tad to sweet, pretty good overall

Now this was good and well worth the hype.  Had this the same night as Parabola and it wasnt even close.  Pours black with thin tan head.  Aromas of coffee, oak, and mild vanilla with the flavors of coffee and everything you would expect from barrel aged beer.  Amazing!

Pours super dark with a thin brown ring. Mild carbonation. Aroma is dark cocoa, molasses, coffee, and chocolate. Taste is creamy chocolate, bourbon, wood, tobacco, and port. Very complex and very well done.

Bottle, generously split and shared by bytemesis. Thanks so much Mike! Pours a ridiculously thick, motor oil like viscosity, void of any light, creating a frothy brown head from the depths of the glass. Swirling the glass unlocks monstrous brownie/fudge aromas, strong bourbon, deep and delicate roasted malts and some sweet dark fruits intertwined to even it out the robust qualities. Spotty lacing, but huge legs are revealed. Taste is very impressive with a silky and coating dark chocolate notes, woody, roasty, peppery, more bourbon with an aggressive bitterness to even out the marshmallow sweetness. Both bitterness and sweetness are woven flawlessly to keep each other in check. I honestly was a little turned off by the figgy aroma, but that is nowhere to be found in the taste. Finish is very lasting, with a nice alcohol warmth that is very inviting. This beer encompass everything I want in the style: bitterness, chocolate, and heat.

yellow wax - Thick pour. Pitch black 
Nose is licorice and cocoa with a vanilla sweetness 
Boozy, spiced, chocolate and sweet. Finish is very sweet and loaded with vanilla and some dark fruits.

Bottle from Batch 1 (Red Wax). Thick black pour with a small tan head and low carbonation. Intense rye, vanilla, and oak aromas. Big chocolate, roast, fudge, cocoa, and oak. Mild booze, licorice, and dark fruit. Sweet flavor of whiskey and vanilla. Chocolate, fudge, and dark fruit. Some alcohol, hints of licorice, and a nice coffee bite on the finish.

Bottle shared in GTMW line - Pours deep black with a thin tan ring of head. Tons of brown sugar sweetness in the nose and lots of sharp heat. Taste is really sweet and sugary--not dry or roasty all all. Pretty grainy and no heat. Real smooth but diabeetus sweet--way too sweet for my tastes. Thick and milkshaky in the mouth. I had a hard time with my small sample--I couldnt imagine a full pour of this.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, thanks Caleb! Dark black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of lots of coconut, dark fruit, chocolate, espresso, hints of earth, touch of cocoa, lots of bourbon.  Taste is a mix of dark fruits, chocolate, roast, nice bourbon, lots of coffee, hints of oak, nice earth, dark espresso, finishing sweet, bourbon, slightly sweet.  Very tasty.
2013. Mornin Delight blows this to shreds. A bit of dark cherries, needs more depth of roast. Pretty acetic; dark fruits. Not for me, really. Good, not great.

Bottle shared at GTMW line, pours black with a thick brown head and lacing, the aroma is huge, chocolate, fudge, whiskey and vanilla, super sweet, kind of reminds me of a fresh Dark Lord, the flavor is just as sweet as the aroma, tons of chocolate mixed in with some oak and vanilla, nice thick mouthfeel, good stuff, just really sweet, glad I only had a small sample, couldnt put down 16oz of this stuff in one sitting.

Wow. This was a big surprise for me. Big dark pour, thick, tan head that sticks around. Big chocolate, a hint of coffee and a nice whiskey smell. Awesome mouthfeel - thick but not overbearing. Big sweet malts give way to chocolate, coffee and whiskey heat. Beautiful, balanced but still feels aggressive with some boozy heat.

Bottle shared by TheAlum at DLD 2013- thanks a ton, Adam! Pours an opaque brown with a tan head. Aroma of molasses, chocolate, syrup, caramel, dark and dried fruits (dates, figs, raisins), and some warmth from the barrels. Flavor of molasses, brown sugar, caramel, figs, dates, chocolate, and some toasted malts. Medium-full bodied, with a viscous mouthfeel and low carbonation. Big, bold, sweet, smooth - good gravy, this is delicious.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head that fades quick. Aroma of vanilla and bourbon. Taste is thick and very sweet lots of chocolate bar and coconut
22oz bottle shared by Ryan, thanks! lt brown-black that sheets/has legs.  A-a bit hot, whiskey, vanilla, roasty/chocolate-dk malt, some spice.  T-balanced, whiskey, roasty/chocolate-dk malt.  Smooth.

Bottle from Toppling Goliath, dark brown pour with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, barrel notes, boozy kick. Taste is nice roasty/malty chocolate, almost roasted marshmallow, nice wood flavors. Insane beer, wish I has more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

April 20, 2013 - bottle shared by Brandon.  Black pour with a light brown head that faded quickly.  Aroma was chocolate, vanilla, spice and whiskey.  Taste was consistent with aroma.  Wow, this was amazing.  Did not have big expectations going in, but this delivered.  TG is officially on my radar.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Poured into brandy glass. Aroma: oak, molasses, and soy bloomed into chocolately bourbon in the glass. Appearance: frothy, light-brown head. Pours a motor oil--and feels that way on the..Palate: slick, thick, syrupy. Leaves sweet chocolate residue. Taste: Tangy and sweet chocolate, bourbon and dried fruits (raisins/dates). 

This seemed to me like a sweeter and tangier version of BCBS. Excellent beer, but the price (29 for a bomber at Johns) is more killer than the beer.

------- Pappy Barrel Aged Assassin

Aroma: thick soy, burnt sugars, and worn leather cohere nicely on the nose. Appearance: jet black with mocha colored foam rimming the surface. Taste: sweet raisins and bitter chocolate fade against a soft background of bourbon heat, sweet vanilla, bitter oak. Ends on a tangy/umami note. Palate: full bodied, thick and syrupy but with a surprising cola-like refreshing feel.

22 oz bottle from badbeer. Thanks, Mike! Popping at the gills, I had to share this at Flossmoor Release. Pours a deep inky black pour, dark and ominous, thick with legs. A frothy brownish head atop dies to a film, laces small. Aromas are cocoa, marshmellow, some wet oak and spirit. Vanilla, whiskey, and gentle roasty malts. Marshmellow, cocoa, creamy toffee and toast. Mellow roast. Initial is firmer big body, roasty, toasty, and cocoa. Cacao, mellow coffee. Firmer body, mellow roasty elements and spirit. Touches of warmth, whiskey, spirit. Darker fluffy malts, barrel, vanilla. Toasty, some vanilla. Firmer body, roasty into the backend. Full yet not hot. Good body, mellow yet growing oak, mellow spirit. Good flavors, roast, toast, toffee. Coffee, roast, sweeter malts. Still a firm body, mellow oak and whiskey spirit. Pretty nice offering here. Really nice beer here, mellow carbonation, rich flavors. Tasty.

Red Wax. Ink black beer, very thick-looking. Pours with very little head, even with a belgian pour. SMell is bourbon, crackers, fudge, port, coffee, vanilla, oak. Mouthfeel is thick.. Taste of soy sauce, burnt caramel, fudge, sugar, bourbon. It is pretty decent. A bit cloying at times.

Bottle. Thanks to Bob for bringing this to try while we visited the brewpub! Pours a dark brown color with a slight tan head. Beer coats the glass leaving an iodine like color on the sides of the glass. Dark fruit notes in the nose with slight barrel. Molasses as well. Heavy mouthfeel. sweet dark fruit, brown sugar, slight coffee roast, and some barrel round out the flavor. Very smooth drinking. Pretty tasty and a cool ass bottle to boot.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2013 Tap. Holy sh*t this is good. Pours opaque black with a medium deep brown head, creamy, some lacing. Aroma is chocolate, dark roasted malt, bourbon, coffee, quite intoxicating. Flavor its even better, quite sweet but not cloying, light coffee bitterness, wonderful balance between the bourbon and stout flavors, and completely masks its huge ABV even through the finish. Full bodied and silky.

Enjoyed at GTMW 2012 from a friend met in line for the pouring of Morning Delight.  Pours a dark brown with a cream head. Smelled of chocolate and cream. Although this is a very big beer, it was smooth with cocoa and coffee flavors. Creamy aftertaste.

Shared in line to Toppling Goliaths line at the GTMW.  This beer was fabulous.  Pitch black.  Chocolate, coffee, marshmallow, rye, and bourbon.  Delicious!  Wish I had another pour.  Awesome velvety caramelized mouthfeel.

Bottle as Dexters, pre-GTMW, huge thanks to Clark and the rest of the crew!  Poured inky black with a swirly dark beige head.  The aroma picked up rich chocolates, coffee, and molasses with plenty of roast to em.. subtle, complementary whiskey, black pepper, and oak accented.. rich and lovely.  The flavor found lightly-smoked dark chocolates, coffee, and maple at the core with tangy rye whiskey and oak accents.. a lot more oak and peppery whiskey over decadent malts on the long finish.  Heavy-bodied and syrupy on the palate.. buttery-smooth across the middle.. great balance.  This was most excellent!

GTMW.  Thanks to Clark for breaking this open while I was in line.  Aroma is big with roasted malt, chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla, and marshmallow.  Light booze.  Flavor continues this theme with more roasted malt, sweet brown sugar, vanilla cream, and light whiskey/bourbon.  Roasted malt finish falls apart a bit with some acidic harshness from the coffee and a slight tinge of booze.  Big and thick on the palate.

Bottle at Dexters Pub, pre-GTMW. Thanks to Bob for the honor of the first sample! Pours jet-black, like a mixture of week-old coffee and motor oil. Small ring of brown head. Nose is big whiskey characters, some anise, a bit of blackberry, sharp rye. Taste follows suit: big and boozy, with some licorice-infused dark chocolates, straight rye whiskey, dark fruits. Hot, oily finish. Incredibly brash, but quite the achievement.

Black pour small tan head just looks thick.  Aroma of whiskey chocolate butter more chocolate.  Huge thick mouth feel.  Flavor is chocolate whiskey butter oak and love.  This is phenominal.
Thanks to Clark for sharing the bottle.  Ir TY chief

Bottle at dexters. Pours jet Blake with small tan head. Aroma of dark candy sugar, molasses, candied raisins, and plums. Flavors is extremely sweet, molasses, cognac, raisins, Black cherries, caramel, coffee and subtle whiskey finish. Syrupy body. Really reminds of dark lord (when its without flaws and just a sweet brew)  and doesnt have a lot of barrel character. Pretty good and I could see sweet impy fans loving it.

Poured an opaque black color with a brown head. Smelled of fresh date, molasses, chocolate liqueur, raisin, and anise. Full bodied and very sweet. Oily in the mouth with a light warming alcohol effect. Chocolate, anise, and dark fruit flavors. Very nice.
This is a great beer. TG is gaining wide acclaim for their love of hops, but their stouts are incredible and worthy of your attention.

22 ounce bottle courtesy of ekoerper, thanks a ton Ed!  Shared this with Preismj, following Hunahpu day, brought the bottle to the event to share, but not enough time to share with everyone due to the massive tap list.  Poured a dark slightly thick black color with a tan head.  Huge aromas of coffee, caramel, slight alcohol aroma, vanilla, and some sweet chocolate.  Flavors start out slightly bitter followed by some sweet caramel and chocolate, and then ends with a nice dose of booze in the aftertaste.  Wow, this beer was amazing, and for this to from the first bottling, I am impressed.  I am in debt to Ed for this one, he hooked me up.  Please send more!

Bottle.  Aroma: coffee, lots of caramel and chocolate, sweet and rich, a bit of an alcohol note but not terribly boozy, nice subtle whiskey/barrel character.  Pours thick as motor oil and inky black, a tan head barely breaks the surface from an aggressive pour and dissipates immediately.  Flavor: moderately high bitterness, big chewy malt character - plenty of caramel, chocolate, and roasty notes.  The barrel character is present but not overwhelming - there is a nice spicy whiskey touch to the beer.  Coffee flavors are subtle - I was hoping for more of that big espresso punch thats in the Mornin Delight, but it could be that the time in the barrel mellowed that out.  Fairly sweet finish but not cloying.  Very full body, thick and chewy, low-medium carbonation, nice smooth texture.  Very nice brew.
